reviewText: Will try to remember to write and actual review, but this item looks like what I was in the market for.

This video is so bad! They spend 5 minutes talking and then run through the step twice and then talk forever then do the step a few times and then more talking. It would be so much better if they just did the steps.
The only thing I liked is that when they actually did the steps they did it with their back to you so that you were on the same foot.

I gave up after the first 20 minutes because I was bored to death of the talking. Never worked up a sweat because there was minimal actual dancing.
this is a really good beginner instruction dvd.  Its really easy to follow and the instructors are easy to watch and listen to.

Before venturing into the world of Lindy, make sure you get this DVD first. You'll thank me later. It is totally fine learning from DVDs (that was one of my fears, but it's fine) and you'll be dancing in no time, thanks to Daniel and Tiffany. They were great (as always).

Lindy Hop is about the most fun you can have on the dance floor. And this DVD is a great way to start.

This is a very good dance-instruction video.  It is well thought out and planned for optimal learning and very well enacted.  It makes learning Lindy pretty easy though I would definitely recommend learning East Coast Swing before Lindy.  The DVD itself would not play on one of my players so beware of that.

For a total beginner non-dancer, this dvd was great. Compared to going to a group class, this was much better because you can go at your own pace, replay and pause to get the basics down. Higly recommended and much better than what was available free on the Internet.
